page.title: 08LAINDON COMMUNITY HALL BURNS
page.content: One of the most unfortunate events in Laindon this year has been the burning of the{Community Centre in Aston Road on 14th February 1985. The fire was discovered at 3 a.m. by a police patrol. Firemen had to come from Basildon, Billericay and Corringham. It took them over an hour to bring the blaze under control. The firemen's job was made more difficult by the cold weather. Hoses were frozen to the ground and the water turned to icicles. Between sixty to seventy local community groups used the centre. Basildon Council have tried to get them temporary accommodation. No one knows the real cause of the fire.
